snippet: The move is the latest twist in the case involving the filmmaker, who is wanted in California over a 1977 conviction for having sex with a 13-year-old girl.
abstract: Polish government says it will renew effort to extradite filmmaker Roman Polanski, who fled there from United States in 1977 after pleading guilty to having sex with 13-year-old girl; statement adds new twist to ongoing extradition battle.

byline.original: By SEWELL CHAN and JOANNA BERENDT
byline.contributor: Sewell Chan reported from London, and Joanna Berendt from Gdansk, Poland.

lead_paragraph: The move is the latest twist in the case involving the filmmaker, who is wanted in California over a 1977 conviction for having sex with a 13-year-old girl.

headline.main: Poland Revives Effort to Extradite Roman Polanski
headline.print_headline: Poland Revives Push to Extradite Polanski Over 1970s Sex Crime Conviction
